titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Vince Biggerstaff, Jones Kirkpatrick & Lesley Wilson, Indictment
CWG5346

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment.
Vince Biggerstaff, Jones Kirkpatrick & Lesley Wilson

The Grand Jury of Cumberland County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Vince Biggerstaff James Kirkpatrick & Lesley Wilson of the Crime of Robbery Committed as follows to wit. The said Biggerstaff Kirkpatrick & Wilson heretofore to wit. on on the day 1866 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and forcibly take from and in the presents of Henry Pace one horse by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person which said horse was then and there the property of said Pace and was of the value of fifty Dollars and was taken against his will against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J H C Sandige
Attorney for the Commonwealth
A copy
attest
E J Ellison Clk
Robbery
IndictmentThe Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Vince Biggerstaff &cFiled on the 20th day of April 1866
C. P Gray clkA True Bill
T J Cloyd
Foreman

Henry S Pace
C. C. Pace

B C Greer
William Clark

Cumberland Cir Ct
vs
Vince Biggerstaff
Jas Kirkpatrick
&

Indicted
